newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico livestock report, feeder export price - USDA.
newsitem.headline: Mexico livestock report, feeder export price - USDA.

text.p: USDA reported Wednesday that around 1,400 head were exported into the United States at three crossing points Tuesday.

Through Santa Teresa, New Mexico, around 1,000 steer calves were sold at steady prices compared to last week. "Trade moderate, demand moderate. Bulk of supply consisted of steers weighing 300-500 lb," the USDA said.
Prices for cattle weighing 300-400 lb were 91-101 cents/lb and for 400-500 lb head at 81-91 cents/lb.
Through Laredo and Del Rio, Texas, around 200 head were sold at each crossing point, although not enough to establish market trend or quote prices.
